title: A Two-day Workshop on Artificial Intelligence and Robotics
subtitle: Empowering Educators with Future-Ready Technologies

metadata.title: AI & Robotics Workshop 2026 | Shivalik College of Engineering
metadata.description: A comprehensive two-day workshop on Artificial Intelligence and Robotics held at Shivalik College of Engineering, focusing on emerging technologies and their applications in education.

introduction.heading: Bridging Theory and Practice in Modern Education
content: As the growing global demand for Artificial Intelligence and Robotics continues to rise, Shivalik College of Engineering organized a two-day workshop on Artificial Intelligence and Robotics from January 21–22, 2026, focusing on emerging technologies and their applications in the field of education.

Artificial Intelligence and Robotics are transforming modern education by enhancing teaching methodologies, fostering innovation, and preparing educators to equip students with future-ready skills. The workshop aimed to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical applications, enabling professionals to integrate advanced technologies into classroom learning and promote experiential education.

objectives: Bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical applications
Enable integration of advanced technologies into classroom learning
Enhance teaching methodologies with AI tools

expertSessions.name: Mr. Shiv Singh
expertSessions.topic: AI Tools and Applications in Education

inauguration.heading: Inaugural Ceremony
inauguration.content: The inaugural ceremony was graced by Er. Ajay Kumar, Vice Chancellor, and Dr. T. S. Sidhu, Director, along with Dr. Surmudhar Pant, Director IQAC, and Dr. Sumit Kumar, Head (CSE). The dignitaries addressed the participating teachers and emphasized the growing importance of AI and robotics in modern pedagogy and curriculum development.

outcomes.heading: Workshop Outcomes
outcomes.content: The workshop was successfully coordinated by Mr. Kshitij Jain and Dr. Abhishek Sharma, with support from the Shivalik Admission Team. The event witnessed enthusiastic participation from 40–50 teachers from CBSE-affiliated schools. Faculty members Mrs. Shivali Pundir, Ms. Swati Khashyap, and Ms. Vandna Bansal were also present, contributing to the smooth conduct and success of the program.
